skill.name: frontend-dev-guidelines
skill.description: Frontend development guidelines for Next.js + React 19 + shadcn/ui applications. Modern patterns including App Router, Server Components, Client Components, Server Actions, shadcn/ui with Tailwind CSS, React Hook Form, lazy loading, Suspense boundaries, Supabase client integration, performance optimization, and TypeScript best practices. Use when creating pages, components, forms, styling, data fetching, new features or working with Next.js/React code.
skill.summary: Frontend development guidelines for Next.js + React 19 + shadcn/ui applications. Modern patterns inc...
skill.author: BOM-98

security_audit.summary: This skill is pure documentation containing markdown files with frontend development guidelines. All 628 static findings are false positives - the scanner detected patterns in documentation (markdown backticks, TypeScript code examples, file path references) that were misidentified as security risks. The skill contains no executable code, no network calls, no file system operations, and no command execution.

content.user_title: Apply Next.js and React frontend guidelines
content.value_statement: This skill provides comprehensive guidelines for building modern frontend applications with Next.js, React 19, and shadcn/ui. It covers essential patterns including Server Components, data fetching, forms, styling, and performance optimization.
actual_capabilities: Guide Server vs Client Component usage in Next.js App Router
Provide shadcn/ui component patterns with Tailwind CSS styling
Show data fetching patterns with Server Components and TanStack Query
Demonstrate React Hook Form with Zod validation
Recommend performance optimization techniques including lazy loading
Explain TypeScript best practices for component props and types
limitations: This skill provides guidelines, not executable code templates
Does not install dependencies or configure build tools
Does not generate complete project scaffolds
Requires manual implementation of suggested patterns

use_cases.title: Build Next.js applications
use_cases.description: Get guidance on structuring Next.js apps with App Router, Server Components, and modern React patterns.

use_cases.title: Learn component patterns
use_cases.description: Understand when to use Client vs Server Components and how to implement lazy loading with Suspense.

use_cases.title: Integrate Supabase
use_cases.description: Learn server-side and client-side Supabase integration patterns for authentication and data fetching.

prompt_templates.title: Component Basics
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to create a new Server Component with shadcn/ui and Tailwind CSS in Next.js App Router

prompt_templates.title: Data Fetching
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I fetch data from Supabase in a Server Component and handle loading states?

prompt_templates.title: Form Validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a login form with React Hook Form and Zod validation using shadcn/ui components

prompt_templates.title: Performance
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I lazy load a heavy DataGrid component with React.lazy and Suspense?

output_examples.input: How do I create a new page in Next.js App Router?
output: Create app/[route]/page.tsx as a Server Component by default
Fetch data directly in the component (no hooks needed)
Add loading.tsx for Suspense-based loading state
Add error.tsx for error boundary handling
Use Tailwind CSS for all styling

output_examples.input: When should I use Server vs Client Components?
output: Use Server Components by default for better performance
Add 'use client' directive only when needed for:
Keep expensive computations on the server to reduce client bundle

output_examples.input: How do I style components with shadcn/ui?
output: Use the cn() utility for conditional classes
Apply Tailwind classes directly to elements
Leverage Radix UI primitives for accessibility

best_practices: Start with Server Components and only add 'use client' when React hooks or event handlers are required
Use shadcn/ui components with Tailwind CSS for consistent, accessible UI
Implement loading.tsx and error.tsx files for each route segment
anti_patterns: Avoid adding 'use client' to every component - this defeats server rendering benefits
Do not use inline styles when Tailwind CSS is available
Avoid direct database queries in Client Components - use Server Components or Server Actions instead

faq.question: What is the recommended folder structure?
faq.answer: Use app/ for Next.js pages, components/ui for shadcn components, and lib/ for utilities like Supabase clients.

faq.question: How do I handle authentication?
faq.answer: Use Supabase auth with createServerClient for Server Components and createClient for Client Components.

faq.question: When should I use TanStack Query?
faq.answer: Use TanStack Query for client-side caching, optimistic updates, and complex data synchronization scenarios.

faq.question: How do I optimize performance?
faq.answer: Lazy load heavy components with React.lazy, use Suspense boundaries, and prefer Server Components for data fetching.

faq.question: Can I use this with Vue or Angular?
faq.answer: Adapt the principles - component composition, type safety, and performance optimization apply to any framework.

faq.question: Does this work with the Pages Router?
faq.answer: This guide focuses on App Router patterns. Pages Router uses different conventions for data fetching and layouts.
